TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Paragraph

Docs.summary: Represents a single paragraph in a selection, range, or document.

remarks.para: The Paragraph object is a member of the collection. The Paragraphs collection includes all the paragraphs in a selection, range, or document.
Use Paragraphs(), where is the index number, to return a single Paragraph object.
Use the , InsertParagraph, InsertParagraphAfter, or InsertParagraphBefore method to add a new, blank paragraph to a document.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int AddSpaceBetweenFarEastAndAlpha { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.AddSpaceBetweenFarEastAndAlpha : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word is set to automatically add spaces between Japanese and Latin text for the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word is set to automatically add spaces between Japanese and Latin text for the specified paragraphs, and False if not. Set the value of this property to True or False to enable or disable the functionality.
This property returns wdUndefined if it’s set to True for only some of the specified paragraphs.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int AddSpaceBetweenFarEastAndDigit { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.AddSpaceBetweenFarEastAndDigit : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word is set to automatically add spaces between Japanese text and numbers for the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word is set to automatically add spaces between Japanese text and numbers for the specified paragraphs, and False if not.
This property returns wdUndefined if it’s set to True for only some of the specified paragraphs.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdParagraphAlignment Alignment { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdParagraphAlignment get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdParagraphAlignment value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a constant that represents the alignment for the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: WdParagraphAlignment can be one of the following constants:
Some of the constants listed above may not be available to you, depending on the language support (U.S. English, for example) that you’ve selected or installed.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the Microsoft Word application.

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word is set to automatically adjust the right indent for the specified paragraphs if you’ve specified a set number of characters per line.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word is set to automatically adjust the right indent for the specified paragraphs if you’ve specified a set number of characters per line, and False if not. Set the property value to True or False to enable or disable the functionality.
This property returns wdUndefined if the AutoAdjustRightIndent property is set to True for only some of the specified paragraphs.

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the value (in characters) for a first-line or hanging indent.

remarks.para: Use a positive value to set a first-line indent, and use a negative value to set a hanging indent.

Docs.summary: Removes any spacing before the specified paragraphs.

Docs.summary: Returns or sets whether the specified paragraph is currently in a collapsed state. Read-write Boolean (bool in C#).

Docs.summary: Returns or sets whether the specified paragraph is collapsed by default when the document loads. Read-write Boolean (bool in C#).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the specified object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int DisableLineHeightGrid { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.DisableLineHeightGrid : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word aligns characters in the specified paragraphs to the line grid when a set number of lines per page is specified.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word aligns characters in the specified paragraphs to the line grid when a set number of lines per page is specified, and False if not. Set the property value to True or False to enable or disable the functionality.
This property returns wdUndefined if the DisableLineHeightGrid property is set to True for only some of the specified paragraphs.

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word applies East Asian line-breaking rules to the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word applies East Asian line-breaking rules to the specified paragraphs, and False if not. Set the property value to True or False to enable or disable the functionality.
This property returns wdUndefined if the FarEastLineBreakControl property is set to True for only some of the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word changes punctuation symbols at the beginning of a line to half-width characters for the specified paragraphs, and False if not. Set the property value to True or False to enable or disable the functionality.

Docs.summary: Determines if the specified paragraphs are included in automatic hyphenation.

remarks.para: This property returns True if the specified paragraphs are included in automatic hyphenation, and False if the specified paragraphs are to be excluded from automatic hyphenation. Set the property value to True or False to enable or disable the functionality.
Possible return values are True, False or wdUndefined.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ID { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.ID : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the identifying label for the specified object when the current document is saved as a Web page.

remarks.para: With the exception of the object, you can use a label as a hyperlink reference from other Web pages or from within the current document.
Microsoft Word does not store the ID property setting for a object. If you set the ID property and then return its value, the returned value will be an empty string.

Docs.summary: Indents one or more paragraphs by one level.

remarks.para: Using this method is equivalent to clicking the Increase Indent button on the Formatting toolbar.

member this.LeftIndent : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Single that represents the left indent value (in points) for the specified paragraphs, table rows, or HTML division.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float LineSpacing { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.LineSpacing : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the line spacing (in points) for the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: The LineSpacing property can be set after the property has been set to the following:
wdLineSpaceAtLeast - The line spacing can be greater than or equal to, but never less than, the specified LineSpacing value.
wdLineSpaceExactly - The line spacing never changes from the specified LineSpacing value, even if a larger font is used within the paragraph.
wdLineSpaceMultiple - A LineSpacing property value must be specified, in points.
Use the LinesToPoints method to convert a number of lines to the corresponding value in points.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLineSpacing LineSpacingRule { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLineSpacing get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLineSpacing value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the line spacing for the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: can be one of the following constants:

Use wdLineSpaceSingle, wdLineSpace1pt5, or wdLineSpaceDouble to set the line spacing to one of these values. To set the line spacing to an exact number of points or to a multiple number of lines, you must also set the property.

MemberSignature.Usage: paragraph.ListAdvanceTo (Level1, Level2, Level3, Level4, Level5, Level6, Level7, Level8, Level9)

Docs.summary: Sets the list levels for a paragraph in a list.

remarks.para: Microsoft Office Word adjusts the numbering value to be used for numbering each list level for the specified paragraph by inserting the necessary intervening paragraphs as hidden text between the specified paragraph and the previous paragraph.

member this.NoLineNumber : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if line numbers are repressed for the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: This property returns True if line numbers are repressed for the specified paragraphs, and False if not. Set the property value to True or False to enable or disable the functionality.
Possible values are True, False, or wdUndefined.
Use the property to set line numbers.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OpenOrCloseUp() runtime managed

Docs.summary: If spacing before the specified paragraphs is 0 (zero), this method sets spacing to 12 points. If spacing before the paragraphs is greater than 0 (zero), this method sets spacing to 0 (zero).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OpenUp() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Sets spacing before the specified paragraphs to 12 points.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Outdent() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Removes one level of indent for one or more paragraphs.

remarks.para: Using this method is equivalent to clicking the Decrease Indent button on the Formatting toolbar.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OutlineDemote() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Applies the next heading level style (Heading 1 through Heading 8) to the specified paragraph or paragraphs.

remarks.para: For example, if a paragraph is formatted with the Heading 2 style, this method demotes the paragraph by changing the style to Heading 3.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OutlineDemoteToBody() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Demotes the specified paragraph or paragraphs to body text by applying the Normal style.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdOutlineLevel OutlineLevel { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdOutlineLevel get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdOutlineLevel value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the outline level for the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: If a paragraph has a heading style applied to it (Heading 1 through Heading 9), the outline level is the same as the heading style and cannot be changed.
Outline levels are visible only in outline view or the document map pane.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OutlinePromote() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Applies the previous heading level style (Heading 1 through Heading 8) to the specified paragraph or paragraphs.

remarks.para: For example, if a paragraph is formatted with the Heading 2 style, this method promotes the paragraph by changing the style to Heading 1.

member this.PageBreakBefore : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if a page break is forced before the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: This property returns True if a page break is forced before the specified paragraphs, and False if not. Set the property value to True or False to enable or disable the functionality
Possible return values are True, False, or wdUndefined.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Reset() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Removes manual paragraph formatting (formatting not applied using a style).

remarks.para: If you manually right align a paragraph and the underlying style has a different alignment, the Reset method changes the alignment to match the formatting of the underlying style.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ResetAdvanceTo() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Resets a paragraph that uses custom list levels to the original level settings.

remarks.para: Microsoft Office Word adjusts the numbering value to be used for numbering each list level for the specified paragraph by removing any intervening hidden paragraphs between the specified paragraph and the previous paragraph.

remarks.para: If the SelectNumber method is called from a paragraph, selection, or range that does not contain a list, an error message is displayed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SeparateList() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Separates a list into two separate lists. For numbered lists, the new list restarts numbering at the starting number, usually 1.

public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Shading ^ Shading { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Shading ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that refers to the shading formatting for the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Space1() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Single-spaces the specified paragraphs. The exact spacing is determined by the font size of the largest characters in each paragraph.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Space15() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Formats the specified paragraphs with 1.5-line spacing.

remarks.para: The exact spacing is determined by adding 6 points to the font size of the largest character in each paragraph.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Space2() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Double-spaces the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: The exact spacing is determined by adding 12 points to the font size of the largest character in each paragraph.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float SpaceAfter { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.SpaceAfter : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the amount of spacing (in points) after the specified paragraph or text column.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int SpaceAfterAuto { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.SpaceAfterAuto : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word automatically sets the amount of spacing after the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word automatically sets the amount of spacing after the specified paragraphs, and False if not. Set the property value to True or False to enable or disable the functionality.
This property returns wdUndefined if the SpaceAfterAuto property is set to True for only some of the specified paragraphs.
When you open an HTML document without cascading style sheets, Word automatically sets the SpaceAfterAuto property to True to render the paragraph spacing exactly as it would appear in a Web browser.
If SpaceAfterAuto is set to True, the property is ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float SpaceBefore { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.SpaceBefore : single with get, set

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int SpaceBeforeAuto { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.SpaceBeforeAuto : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word automatically sets the amount of spacing before the specified paragraphs.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word automatically sets the amount of spacing before the specified paragraphs, and False if not. Set the property value to True or False to enable or disable the functionality.
This property returns wdUndefined if the SpaceBeforeAuto property is set to True for only some of the specified paragraphs.

When you open an HTML document without cascading style sheets, Word automatically sets the SpaceBeforeAuto property to True to render the paragraph spacing exactly as it would appear in a Web browser.
If SpaceBeforeAuto is set to True, the property is ignored.

When you return the style for a range that includes more than one style, only the first character or paragraph style is returned.

Docs.summary: Determines if the first and last lines in the specified paragraph remain on the same page as the rest of the paragraph when Microsoft Word repaginates the document.

remarks.para: This property returns True if the first and last lines in the specified paragraph remain on the same page as the rest of the paragraph when Word repaginates the document, and False if not. Set the property value to True or False to enable or disable the functionality.
Possible values are True, False and wdUndefined.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int WordWrap { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.WordWrap : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word wraps Latin text in the middle of a word in the specified paragraphs or text frames.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word wraps Latin text in the middle of a word in the specified paragraphs or text frames, and False if not. Set the property value to True or False to enable or disable the functionality.

This property returns wdUndefined if it’s set to True for only some of the specified paragraphs or text frames. This usage may not be available to you, depending on the language support (U.S. English, for example) that you’ve selected or installed.
